intro: Hieracium glauciforme, commonly known as the bluish hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium glauciforme is often found in open habitats and can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some areas.
